de.mrapp.android.dialog.model

Interface MaterialDialogDecorator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Dialog
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ButtonBarDialog, HeaderDialog, ListDialog, MaterialDialog, ValidateableDialog
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractButtonBarDialog, AbstractHeaderDialog, AbstractHeaderDialogFragment, AbstractListDialog, AbstractMaterialDialog, AbstractValidateableDialog, MaterialDialog, MaterialDialogDecorator, ProgressDialog, WizardDialog

    public interface MaterialDialogDecorator
extends Dialog
    Defines the interface a decorator, which allows to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices, must implement.
    Since:
    3.2.0

      • getIcon

        Drawable getIcon()
        Returns the icon of the dialog.
        Returns:
        The icon of the dialog, as an instance of the class Drawable or null, if no icon has been set

      • setIcon

        void setIcon(@Nullable
             Drawable icon)
        Sets the icon of the dialog.
        Parameters:
        icon - The icon, which should be set, as an instance of the class Drawable or null, if no icon should be shown

      • setIconAttribute

        void setIconAttribute(@AttrRes
                      int attributeId)
        Set the icon of the dialog.
        Parameters:
        attributeId - The id of the theme attribute, which supplies the icon, which should be set, as an Integer value. The id must point to a valid drawable resource

      • isContentDividerShown

        boolean isContentDividerShown()
        Returns, whether the divider, which is located above the dialog's custom view, is shown, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the divider, which is located above the dialog's custom view, is shown, false otherwise
